reviews.review_msg: Very helpful and genuinely concerned about students well being.  A real class-act!  Allows students to direct the focus during seminars.
she's a very knowledgeable prof. fair marker. tried to get our tutorial engaged in discussion. will defiantly help you if you ask. recommended.

I agree! I took this class this semester and was far by the easiest crim classes ever taken! Break down of marks were 20%! She's great for any class!! More than fair and generous on marks! Approachable anytime for questions!! We should have more professors like Raegan Carmichael !! I totally recommend her and would take another class with her again

Great Professor!! Had her, no complaints!! Marks were more than generous!! She bumped up the midterm marks by 13% which brought me to an A-!! Who ever says she's not a good professor obviously were slackers who did not put in effort!! Put in the effort guys, and you will get the marks!! term paper, midterm, 20%!! Easy marker! I got an A- final mark

I don't know why this person think she's useless! I totally DISAGREE!! She is awesome and great!! Gives great insight!! Easy and fair marker!! This course is memorization yes, but it is not hard at all!! An easy GPA booster, if you put in the work!! Raegan is more than fair and understands students!!  She scaled up the midterm marks by 13%!!

Casual, approachable, and a great TA. However, she does not make a good professor. Class felt very first-year, as it was based on rote memorization of terms. Gave very vague requirements for the paper, and then revealed marks were based on a strict criteria not given to the students. Expect this to class to ruin your GPA. (Also it's very boring)

Loved this class, seems like a lot of reading but honestly it's not bad at all. For the papers focus on a clear thesis, that's how you'll get a good mark. Papers and content is very interesting... Great prof & class!

He is very passionate about the topics he choses for these classes and loves to engage in conversation about these topics, however the overall Canvas design is very messy and there are very little details for his expectations on assignments. Funny, engaging prof, reading was not absolutely crucial but should be done. Would take again.

Consisted of one 2,500 word paper (20%), one 3,500 word paper (30%), and one assignment split into two separate papers: one 1,500 words, the other 2,500 words (together  30%). Also need to complete a 10 minute presentation (15%) and participate during other people's presentations (5%). Overall pretty easy, interesting topics, but LOTS of readings

Took this by distance.  Course is superbly organized. Quite a few papers, but they are really clear. No exams. Easy GPA boost. Neil Boyd had no contact with the students in this class, but TM was great. Textbooks are expensive and are only required for assignments. You literally don't need to do any readings.

Informative class. Unfortunately the required textbooks were expensive and useless. The discussion during class was engaging. Yet, the topic often go off and the class was pretty much without any structure. Boyd seems to be helpful when you e-mail him or  during office hour. Boyd sounds friendly, but he is not afraid to be dismissive of your ideas.
Doesn't demonstrate a strong example students interested in having a positive experience with their professors.

This is the fist class I took by distance and it was easy. You MUST stay ontop of your readings and there are lots of them. I have no idea what Boyd did for distance. I emailed him once and never got a responce at all. The TM in this class - by far the worst I ever had. Brittney Boyer. Avoid her like the plague

He has no respect for his students and does not hesitate to talk down to u. He is arrogant and is the worst professor Ive had at SFU. He is no teacher, he is only a lawyer. He's obviously too comfortable with his associate director position and takes advantage of it. A complete waste of money. Needs to realize that he works for us We are paying him

I took this class by distance ed...so I didn't get to meet the prof. I think it was an extremely interesting class eventhough the readings did get long and boring sometimes. We had 3 papers and online participation which was good and no final!! Boyd sounds like a good prof...the TA for this course was good..I think that this course is easier by dis

Yes, he doesn't seem to care about students, but do you really blame him? His seminars are really good- I think he can teach very well. My only complaint is custom courseware/books he makes us buy- expensive- we don't use it- and i think the authors are crap. His own books are much better, but I guess he wants to appear modest. Why bother?

Boyd is not at SFU to teach. He plugs away at his Blackberry during office hours, has vague criteria, and moved the final deadline up (on short notice) so he could leave for holidays early. Liberal viewpoints, which wouldn't be problematic if he weren't so hard-headed about them. If you already know a lot about drug policy,his seminars may bore you
Smart guy. Great lawyer. Bad prof. Arrogant as all hell. But not a whole lot of work is required for his classes. Say what he wants to hear and you should be fine.

Neil is awesome.  He runs the class in such a relaxed style.  While he never gave us a syllabus, made it evident that it didn't matter.  Take time to talk to him about you paper. So knowledgeable and helpful
Really interesting professor- I really liked his class. It's hard but we're in university for god's sake... it's not supposed to be easy!
Excellent professor
incredibly lazy, never available, egotistical
No Comments
